_components.fullString: With a little thought, everyone can work together.
You can always find a way to make ideas work together.
One good compromise is sharing responsibilities
Never say something that is meant to hurt another person.
A little tolerance goes a long way.
Always treat others the way you want to be treated.
You can't cooperate if you don't listen!
Saying or doing things to hurt others is never okay.
Everybody has ideas, so listen up!
Everyone has rights that should be respected.
When you're polite to others, it's much easier to cooperate.
Caring about others is the cornerstone to respect.
When you do a group assignment, it's important to cooperate.
Calling somebody's idea ÒdumbÓ is not respectful.
Being a leader means making sure everyone uses respect.
When no one cooperates, nothing gets done!
When you work together, you can accomplish great things!
Without respect, cooperation and compromise are impossible.
Group projects are opportunities to overcome peer conflict.
Making fun of others doesn't help anything.
The word ÒstupidÓ has no place in a group project.
When you can't work together, you're like a mob of zombies.
Lack of respect can cause any group to explode.
In a group, you should always be willing to compromise.
